title: Front Mudguard - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Front mudguard removal D72; D92; DA2; DB; DB2; DB4; DBB; DBX; DT3; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU; DU3; DU4; DUB; DUC; DUY
Front Wheel Removal DTC; D72; DT3; DT4; DU; DU3; DU4; DUY; DTB; DUB; DUC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DU4; DT4; D72; DU3; DT3; DUY; DU

body.body: Detach the front brake hoses from their wire guides on both sides of the front mudguard.
Remove the fixings and detach the both mudguard stays from the front forks.
Remove and discard the four fixings securing the front mudguard to the front forks and carefully remove the mudguard.
Brake hose cable guide (left hand side shown)

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DA2; DTC; DB4; DT4; DU4; D72; D92; DB2; DU3; DT3; DBX; DB; DUY; DU
